str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
A primary particle, denoting a supposition, wish, possibility or uncertainty.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From skandalon; to entrap, i.e. Trip up (transitively) or entice to sin, apostasy or displeasure).
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
This; he, she, it.
Little, small. Including the comparative mikroteros apparently a primary word; small (figuratively) dignity).
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: From pistis; to have faith, i.e. Credit; by implication, to entrust.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From sun and phero; to bear together, i.e. to collect, or to conduce; especially advantage.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.
Pertaining to an ass. From onos; belonging to a ass, i.e. Large.
A millstone, mill. Probably ultimately from the base of molis; a 'mill', i.e., a grinder.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To hang, hang up, suspend; mid: To be hanging, hang. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to hang.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
The neck. Probably from trecho; the throat, i.e. life.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From kata and a derivative of the same as Pontos; to plunge down, i.e. Submerge.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The sea, the deep. Of uncertain affinity; deep or open sea, i.e. The main.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably prolonged from hals; the sea.
